intro: Tarenna viridis, commonly known as green tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually glossy green. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in small umbels, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. Tarenna viridis is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
